summary: The concept of "university administration," redirected to "educational administration," pertains to the structured governance and regulatory frameworks that oversee the organization of teaching within higher education institutions in the EU. This encompasses the legal obligations and administrative practices that ensure compliance with EU directives on quality assurance, academic freedom, and institutional accountability. Educational administration plays a crucial role in facilitating the effective delivery of educational services, aligning with EU policies aimed at enhancing educational standards and promoting mobility among students and staff. Understanding this concept is essential for navigating the complex regulatory landscape governing higher education in Europe.
